clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Nutritional Deficit in Emergency Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Nutritional Deficit in Emergency Surgery: A Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

clinical_study.source: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

brief_summary.textblock: Patients in emergency settings might become malnourished. There are different ways to identify the group as 'at risk' of malnutrition. There are also several different ways to measure outcomes. This pilot study will look at patients undergoing emergency laparotomy, investigate relationships between different selection criteria and outcome measures, and test feasibility of outcome measure collection.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients in emergency settings might become malnourished. There are different ways to identify the group as 'at risk' of malnutrition. There are also several different ways to measure outcomes. This pilot study will look at patients undergoing emergency laparotomy, investigate relationships between different selection criteria and outcome measures, and test feasibility of outcome measure collection.

primary_outcome.time_frame: within 90 days of admission to hospital
primary_outcome.description: This is defined as the time elapsed between last normal enteral intake, and resumption of enteral intake, or naso-enteric feeding, or parenteral nutrition.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 90 days of admission to hospital
secondary_outcome.description: Complications related to surgery measured using the comprehensive complication index

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of completion of complications at day of discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 90 days of admission to hospital
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with a completed comprehensive complication index

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements take at baseline, 5 days post-operatively and 90 days post-operatively
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using EQ-5D-5L (EuroQol- five dimension - five level)

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of completion of EQ-5D-5L (EuroQol- five dimension - five level) at 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Reported as proportion of respondents replying

arm_group.description: Patients admitted to hospital with acute intra-abdominal pathology

intervention.description: Midline laparotomy for acute intra-abdominal pathology

study_pop.textblock: Patients attending two UK hospitals which provide emergency surgery services who require an emergency laparotomy
